About Me

BIO

Currently studying at the University of Arkansas, I’m always eager to engage in exciting projects. I have a passion for software and using it to solve everyday problems. If you would like to build something together, get in touch!

Experience

Computer Vision and Image Understanding Lab

Research Assistant (Curent)

Working closely with Dr.Khoa Luu to develop applications involving computer vision, deep learning, image processing, and image understanding.

McMillon Innovation Studio

Software Developer Intern (Nov 2017 – May 2018)

Worked directly with NCR Corporation through the McMillon Innovation Studio on a three person development team. Developed efficient prototype solutions for real world problems faced in retail stores globally, using computer vision, image processing and machine learning techniques.

University IT Services

Computer Technician (May 2017 – Oct 2018)

Worked in computer labs on school campus, providing technical support. Primary duties included: Computer software installation and updates and maintenance of computer hardware and software functionality and efficiency.

Achievements

Blockchain Hackathon

2nd Place (October 2017)

Used blockchain technology to address a business use-case challenge. Developed a business solution and proof of concept application that aimed to improve supply chain efficiency and customer satisfaction using the Hyperledger Fabric.

McMillon Entrepreneural Contest

Finalist (August 2017 - December 2017)

Worked on a multidisciplinary team to build a data analysis start-up company that would provide software solutions to increase sales of consumer goods for small to medium-sized retail companies, by providing personalized predictive analysis.
